alert.note: Alert for York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:53AM EST until December 19 at 2:21AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Conestoga River At Lancaster affecting Lancaster and York Counties. For the Conestoga River...including Lancaster...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Conestoga River at Lancaster. * WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Grofftown Road will flood. At 13.0 feet, Several homes are affected by high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Flood stage is 11 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 11.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.7 feet on 06/21/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at midnight EST.
